docs.abstract: The option makes it easier to borrow money and manage cash flow, the companies say, but others caution that it could encourage overspending.
docs.snippet: The option makes it easier to borrow money and manage cash flow, the companies say, but others caution that it could encourage overspending.
docs.lead_paragraph: Spend too much on your summer vacation? Need to replace that sputtering air-conditioner?

headline.main: Credit Card Companies Take Cue From Start-Ups to Offer Flexible Payment Plans
headline.print_headline: New Options if You’re in the Red, and It’s Not a Sunburn

docs.abstract: Frustrated by the steep commissions and discounts that apps like Zomato and Uber Eats push on restaurants, thousands have started a movement to #Logout from them.
docs.snippet: Frustrated by the steep commissions and discounts that apps like Zomato and Uber Eats push on restaurants, thousands have started a movement to #Logout from them.
docs.lead_paragraph: MUMBAI, India — Aakanksha Porwal, the owner of a small retro diner called Vahnilla & Company, recently signed up for the Zomato food delivery app to make dishes like her veggie cheeseburgers and Kit Kat cakesicles available to a wider audience. She also joined Zomato’s Gold program, where she would offer two dishes for the price of one to members who came to dine in person.

headline.main: India’s Restaurants Rebel Against Food Delivery Apps
headline.print_headline: India’s Restaurants, Left With Crumbs, Rebel Against Apps

byline.original: By Vindu Goel and Ayesha Venkataraman

docs.abstract: As sales of multimillion-dollar condos and apartments cool, developers are adding more luxuries to lure buyers.
docs.snippet: As sales of multimillion-dollar condos and apartments cool, developers are adding more luxuries to lure buyers.
docs.lead_paragraph: The luxury condominium and apartment market is in the midst of an amenities war. Pools, playrooms and yoga studios have become commonplace, forcing developers to offer even more lavish add-ons or risk losing prospective buyers willing to pay millions of dollars.

headline.main: Pet Spa? Private Elevator? The Amenities Race Heats Up
headline.print_headline: Pet Spa? Private Elevator? They’re a Must

docs.abstract: The attorneys general of Washington, D.C., and Nebraska accused the hotel chains of deceiving travelers by failing to include the fees in their published room rates.
docs.snippet: The attorneys general of Washington, D.C., and Nebraska accused the hotel chains of deceiving travelers by failing to include the fees in their published room rates.
docs.lead_paragraph: The hotel charges known as resort fees are again under scrutiny — this time, from state attorneys general.

headline.main: Marriott and Hilton Sued Over ‘Resort Fees,’ Long a Bane for Travelers
headline.print_headline: Exposing the ‘Resort Fees’ Guests Pay, Resort or Not

docs.abstract: The social network has struggled to implement a consistent political advertising policy as groups appear able to get around its transparency rules.
docs.snippet: The social network has struggled to implement a consistent political advertising policy as groups appear able to get around its transparency rules.
docs.lead_paragraph: Facebook has banned advertising from The Epoch Times, the Falun Gong-related publication and conservative news outlet, as the social network struggles to implement a consistent political advertising policy.

headline.main: Facebook Bans Ads From The Epoch Times
headline.print_headline: Facebook Bans Ads From The Epoch Times After It Skirted Rules

docs.abstract: A federal appeals court ruled that the chip maker did not have to modify key business practices while the court reviews a lower-court ruling against the company.
docs.snippet: A federal appeals court ruled that the chip maker did not have to modify key business practices while the court reviews a lower-court ruling against the company.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The chip maker Qualcomm does not have to modify key business practices while a federal appeals court reviews an antitrust ruling against it, the court ruled on Friday, a win for the company and a blow to the Federal Trade Commission in a closely watched legal battle.

headline.main: Qualcomm Wins Reprieve in F.T.C. Antitrust Case With Appeals Court Ruling
headline.print_headline: Qualcomm Is Handed a Reprieve in F.T.C. Antitrust Case

docs.abstract: Other searches also appeared related to an investigation that has implicated senior officials from the union and auto-industry executives.
docs.snippet: Other searches also appeared related to an investigation that has implicated senior officials from the union and auto-industry executives.
docs.lead_paragraph: Federal agents on Wednesday raided the home of the president of the United Automobile Workers union in the midst of a widening investigation of financial wrongdoing by union and management officials.

headline.main: F.B.I. Raids U.A.W. Chief’s Home as Financial Inquiry Widens
headline.print_headline: F.B.I. Raids Auto Union Leader’s Home

docs.snippet: Recent commercial real estate transactions in New York.

byline.original: By Melissa Guerrero and Steven Moity

docs.abstract: College entrepreneurs who focus on food products face their own set of challenges, including waste and food safety regulations, experts say.
docs.snippet: College entrepreneurs who focus on food products face their own set of challenges, including waste and food safety regulations, experts say.
docs.lead_paragraph: University students have for years created businesses in their dorm rooms. Although “college entrepreneur” often evokes images of tech founders, a cadre of students is instead focusing on disrupting the food industry.

headline.main: Dorm to Table: College Start-Ups Take Aim at Food Industry
headline.print_headline: From Dorm to Table: College Start-Ups Take Aim at Food Industry

docs.abstract: The needs of older relatives remove women from the labor force in the United States far more than in other wealthy nations, at a cost to the economy.
docs.snippet: The needs of older relatives remove women from the labor force in the United States far more than in other wealthy nations, at a cost to the economy.
docs.lead_paragraph: DUNWOODY, Ga. — Aisha Adkins would rather have her own place, instead of living with her parents. She would also like a job, a car, a master’s degree and savings. But at 35, a decade after graduating from Georgia Southern University in Statesboro with a specialty in social services, she has had to put off those goals.

headline.main: Why Aren’t More Women Working? They’re Caring for Parents
headline.print_headline: In Primes of Careers, Women Bear Burden of Caregiving
